subject: Re: [junit] Webservice testing
msgSnippet: ... As always, what are you trying to test? 1. The logic you re exposing as a web service? 2. The Java/XML mappings? 3. Whether you re using the web service
messageBody:
Praveen AH wrote:

> Can you please share some informations related to Web Service
> testing.I am unit junit tool to call the web service/ soap api from
> there again it calls to the server component which finally gives the
> output.(This is the outline of my testing). Please share your knowledge
> and informations related to webservice testing with me.

As always, what are you trying to test?

1. The logic you're exposing as a web service?
2. The Java/XML mappings?
3. Whether you're using the web service API correctly?
4. Whether your application handles web service responses correctly?

What you're doing so far works well as end-to-end/integration-style
testing, and so if you're happy with it, there's no need to do more. If,
however, you want to test more in isolation, it depends which of those
four you want to test.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
